> If you're just starting with Heritrix, w=
e recommend using 1.14.3.
> 
> With the default configuration, crawling wil=
l generally stay on the 
> sites defined by the seeds, but the crawler will=
 go offsite to get URLs 
> that appear necessary to render on-site pages (s=
uch as embedded images, 
> scripts, stylesheets, etc.). This behavior comes=
 from the 
> 'TransclusionDecideRule' -- so removing that rule or setting i=
ts various 
> '*-hops' limits to zero will prevent the offsite collection.
=
> 
> On the other hand, if you do want necessary offsite resources, but fin=
d 
> Heritrix sometimes going too many hops off, you could reduce those 
> =
TransclusionDecideRule '*-hops' values without moving them to zero. 
> Also=
, Heritrix always considers links found in Javascript or Flash to be 
> lik=
e inline/embedded resources (because it can't tell the difference 
> betwee=
n those that load into the page, or only load on user navigation). 
> So if=
 you find the only reason Heritrix is wandering offsite is such 
> links, y=
ou could disable Javascript extraction (in the ExtractorHTML and 
> Extract=
orJS) and Flash extraction (in ExtractorSWF).
